# Hangar

> Terminal session manager for AI coding agents

Hangar is a TUI (Terminal User Interface) that manages Claude Code sessions from a single dashboard. Built with Go and Bubble Tea, it runs on top of tmux.

## Key Features

- **Project-based sessions**: Every session belongs to a Project with a name, base directory, and base branch
- **Multi-agent dashboard**: See status (running/waiting/idle/error) of all sessions at a glance
- **Session forking**: Fork Claude Code conversations to explore different approaches in parallel
- **Git worktrees**: Isolate agent work on separate branches automatically, pulling base branch first
- **Colored preview**: Session previews preserve ANSI terminal colors from Claude Code
- **Lazygit integration**: Press `G` to open lazygit in any session's working directory
- **oasis_lagoon_dark theme**: Rounded powerline pill window tabs with status fleet indicator

## Install

```bash
git clone https://github.com/sjoeboo/hangar.git
cd hangar
go install ./cmd/hangar
```

Or via Homebrew: `brew install sjoeboo/tap/hangar`
